thread.title: First committee meeting of ‘The Atlantic Initiative for Tourism’
thread.title_full: First committee meeting of ‘The Atlantic Initiative for Tourism’

author: eTN Global Editor
title: First committee meeting of ‘The Atlantic Initiative for Tourism’
text:
First committee meeting of ‘The Atlantic Initiative for Tourism’   
Sep 16, 2015   
MEDELLIN, Colombia - Following the Atlantic Initiative for Tourism Conference (Rabat, Morocco, in March 2015), representatives from countries on both sides of the Atlantic gathered on the side-lines of the General Assembly to discuss and agree on the next steps needed to advance the implementation of the Rabat Declaration. 
The participants at the Committee Meeting praised Morocco for initiating the 'Atlantic Initiative for Tourism', and agreed to create a working group in order to facilitate coordination of input to a draft action plan.. 
The following countries volunteered to be part of the working group: Benin, Bahamas, Colombia, Cote D’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of Congo, The Gambia, Morocco and Spain. 
Present at the meeting were also Cameroun, Namibia, Portugal, Seychelles, Senegal and Republic of Congo.
